attack_summary.cluster_description: The attack pattern indicates a privilege escalation and unauthorized access attempt, with multiple vulnerabilities exploited, including CVE-1999-0661 and CVE-2000-0525, and suspicious behavior from various system processes. The attacker is attempting to gain elevated access and move laterally within the system. The presence of a malicious kernel module and unusual systemd behavior further supports this assessment.

cve_details.description: Multiple SSH2 servers and clients do not properly handle packets or data elements with incorrect length specifiers, which may allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute ar

A system is running a version of software that was replaced with a Trojan Horse at one of its distribution points, such as (1) TCP Wrappers 7.6, (2) util-linux 2.9g, (3) wuarchive ftpd (wuftpd) 2.2 an
OpenSSH does not properly drop privileges when the UseLogin option is enabled, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands by providing the command to the ssh daemon.
